meanings.definition: The quality or state of being worthy
meanings.sent1: Her worthiness was evident in the way she always helped others.
meanings.sent2: His worthiness as a leader was unquestionable.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's worthiness to be called a good boy was proven by his wagging tail.
meanings.sent4: The worthiness of her efforts shone brightly like a beacon in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The worthiness of the charity's cause touched the hearts of many.

meanings.sent1: The brave firefighter's worthiness actions saved many lives.
meanings.sent2: Her worthiness character made her a role model for others.
meanings.sent3: The cat's worthiness attempt to catch the laser pointer amused everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The worthiness courage of the soldiers inspired the nation.
meanings.sent5: His worthiness deeds will be remembered for generations to come.

meanings.sent1: The antique vase had worthiness value due to its historical significance.
meanings.sent2: The old book was worthiness enough to be passed down through the family.
meanings.sent3: The worthiness price of the ice cream was a whopping ten dollars!
meanings.sent4: Her smile held a worthiness charm that captivated everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The worthiness ring sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.
